title: Mikheil Khutsishvili
text:
Mikhail Khutsishvili (; born 28 January 1979 in <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgia</a>) is a retired <a href="Georgians">Georgian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> striker who last played for <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> club <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">FK Vojvodina</a>. He unexpectedly retired because of serious heart problems. As of January 2016, he is the general director of <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Tbilisi">FC Dinamo Tbilisi</a>.
Career.
Khutsishvili begin his career as senior with Zhineri Zhinvali moving after only a year to the Georgian giant <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Tbilisi">FC Dinamo Tbilisi</a>. He represented in this early period also several other clubs, namely Georgian <a href="FC%20Lokomotivi%20Tbilisi">FC Lokomotivi Tbilisi</a> and <a href="FC%20Merani-91%20Tbilisi">FC Merani-91 Tbilisi</a>, bur also Moldovan <a href="FC%20Sheriff%20Tiraspol">FC Sheriff Tiraspol</a>.
In 1997 he played two games for <a href="Georgia%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Georgian U18 national team</a>.
In 2002, he moved to Greece where he played one season with <a href="Kalamata%20F.C.">Kalamata F.C.</a> and another half season with <a href="PAS%20Giannina%20F.C.">PAS Giannina F.C.</a>. By January 2004 he returned to Georgia this time to play with <a href="FC%20Torpedo%20Kutaisi">FC Torpedo Kutaisi</a> but after six months he moved to Azerbaijan signing with <a href="FK%20G%C3%A4nc%C3%A4">FK Gäncä</a>.
In January <a href="FC%20Sioni%20Bolnisi">FC Sioni Bolnisi</a> brought him back to Georgia what proved to be a good move since he ended up as part of Sioni's <a href="Umaglesi%20Liga%202005-06">2005–06</a> championship winning team. This was followed by the return to his former club <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Tbilisi">FC Dinamo Tbilisi</a> in summer 2006. He stayed with Dinamo 2 seasons winning another Georgian championship in <a href="Umaglesi%20Liga%202007-08">2007–08</a> and being in that same season the <a href="Umaglesi%20Liga">league</a> <a href="Umaglesi%20Liga%23Topscorers">topscorer</a>.
In summer 2008 he moved to Azerbaijani <a href="FK%20Olimpik%20Baku">FK Olimpik Baku</a> but after only 6 months <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> club <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">FK Vojvodina</a> offered him a contract. In summer 2009 he was joined in Vojvodina by another Georgian international footballer, <a href="Giorgi%20Merebashvili">Giorgi Merebashvili</a>, but Khutsishvili started having health problems that season and after being diagnosticated with heart problems he ended abandoning his playing career in 2010.
After retiring he became as head scout of <a href="Vojvodina">Vojvodina</a> for 6 month. Next half year he became sports director of <a href="Dila%20Gori">Dila Gori</a> and then became general director of <a href="FC%20Zestafoni">FC Zestafoni</a> for four years before moving in autumn 2015 to hold the same direction position at Georgian giants <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Tbilisi">FC Dinamo Tbilisi</a>.
